subject: Re: [junit] All Methods Public
msgSnippet: ... There s a reason why Smalltalk environments are dead. It seems to me that helper methods/classes can be useful.  I can certainly see why certain ways to
messageBody:
On 2/19/07, J. B. Rainsberger <jbrains762@...> wrote:
>
> "Helper" is a lullaby word in OO design, like "Manager" and "Worker".
> There's a reason why Smalltalk environments consider utility methods to
> be a code smell.

There's a reason why Smalltalk environments are dead.

It seems to me that helper methods/classes can be useful. I can
certainly see why certain ways to implement them can be considered
"smells", but it certainly doesn't make the overall concept useless.

--
Cédric
http://testng.org
